intro: Astracantha hareftae, commonly known as the Persian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Astracantha hareftae is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a resilient species in challenging environments.
